page.title: 05Farming in the Girvan Valley
page.content: Farming is the most important industry in the Girvan valley, influenced by the{climate, the soil {and the relief. It is only the higher ground level such as{Brae Hill and Camregan Hill that these influences are not beneficial and here it is{sheep farming on rough pasture which dominates. On the lower slopes and valley floor the soils consist of fertile{alluvium, {boulder clay and loam}and the climate is equable, through rather wet (c1000mm). These are ideal conditions for the grazing of both{dairy and beef cattle on permanent pasture, with the main dairy breeds being{Ayrshires, {Fresians, and increasingly, Holstiens. Also important on the valley bottom is the growing of winter fodder, barley and Ayrshire potatoes.
